required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Evaluation of Plane Blocks in Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound-guided Oblique Subcostal Transversus Abdominis Plane Block Versus Serratus Intercostal Plane Block Plus Rectus Sheath Block; in Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy

brief_summary.textblock: the investigators use usually a plane block for postoperative analgesia; if it suitable. İn laparoscopic patients; investigators used oblique subcostal transversus abdominis plane block; formerly. But in the last few months, the investigators have performed serratus intercostal (BRILMA) block with bilateral rectus sheath block. in this retrospective evaluation, the aim of the retrospective evaluation is to determine the effects of two block on postoperative opioid consumption.

primary_outcome.description: Tramadol consumption in Patient Controlled Analgesia device and additional and rescue analgesic using

secondary_outcome.description: Changes in Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) at rest and on movement will be recorded at intervals. NRS is a unidimensional measure of pain intensity in adults. The NRS is a segmented numeric version of the visual analog scale (VAS) in which a respondent selects a whole number (0-10 integers) that best reflects the intensity of his/her pain. The 11-point numeric scale ranges from '0' representing one pain extreme (e.g. "no pain") to '10' representing the other pain extreme (e.g. "pain as bad as you can imagine" or "worst pain imaginable").

arm_group.description: Data of patients (performed oblique subcostal transversus abdominis plane-OSTAP- block for postoperative analgesia in laparoscopic cholecystectomy) will be collected.
Data of patients (performed serratus intercostal plane block-SIPB- plus rectus sheath block for postoperative analgesia in laparoscopic cholecystectomy) will be collected.

intervention.description: this block is performed under general anesthesia in this patients for postoperative analgesia.
this block is performed under general anesthesia in this patients for postoperative analgesia.

study_pop.textblock: adult patients undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy, ASA I-II-III patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients undergoed laparoscopic cholecystectomy ASA I-II-III
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients used another block or block combination
- no block performed patients
- procedure converted to open procedure

reference.citation: Chen Y, Shi K, Xia Y, Zhang X, Papadimos TJ, Xu X, Wang Q. Sensory Assessment and Regression Rate of Bilateral Oblique Subcostal Transversus Abdominis Plane Block in Volunteers. Reg Anesth Pain Med. 2018 Feb;43(2):174-179. doi: 10.1097/AAP.0000000000000715.

Fernández Martín MT, López Álvarez S, Pérez Herrero MA. Serratus-intercostal interfascial block as an opioid-saving strategy in supra-umbilical open surgery. Rev Esp Anestesiol Reanim. 2018 Oct;65(8):456-460. doi: 10.1016/j.redar.2018.03.007. Epub 2018 May 20. English, Spanish.
